step.cmd: In the Order Management page, select in the main navigation bar.
step.stepresult: A window containing a list of search options appears.

step.cmd: Specify the appropriate search options as described in the following table.

row.entry: Enter a serial number or lot number to access the associated work orders. You must enter complete serial number in the SERIAL/LOT box and the application displays only the work order that contains the search text. To search for a work order using a barcode, select , and then scan for the barcode of the serial number or lot number associated with the operation. The application supports the barcodes of standards Code 39 and Code 128 only.

Enter a work order number to access the details of the work order. You must enter the complete work order number in the WORK ORDER box and the application displays only the work order that contains the search text. To search for an operation using a barcode, select , and then scan for the barcode of the work order associated with the operation. The application supports the barcodes of standards Code 39 and Code 128 only.
Select the drop-down list box, and then search for a product to access the associated work orders.
Select the drop-down list box, and then select a work order status to access the associated work orders.

step.cmd: Select for a field to filter a work order. For more information, refer to the topic.

taskbody.result: The work orders based on the specified search criteria appear. To clear the results and perform new search, select Clear Results in the respective application page.
